meanings.definition: Breathe quickly and loudly due to exertion or excitement.
meanings.sent1: After running a long race, Sarah panted heavily.
meanings.sent2: The dog panted after chasing the ball around the yard.
meanings.sent3: The exhausted squirrel panted as it tried to keep up with its energetic friends.
meanings.sent4: The old car panted up the steep hill, struggling to reach the top.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter panted as he carried the rescued kitten out of the burning building.

meanings.definition: Utter a series of short, quick breaths.
meanings.sent1: The child panted with excitement as he opened his birthday present.
meanings.sent2: She panted nervously as she waited for the exam results to be announced.
meanings.sent3: The curious puppy panted with anticipation as it watched the squirrel in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The exhausted runner panted for breath as he crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The phone panted with notifications as messages flooded in one after another.
